intro: Lespedeza homoloba f. rosea, commonly known as the rosea lespedeza, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that produces clusters of small, rose-colored flowers, which give it its common name. The plant has trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. It is native to eastern North America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Lespedeza homoloba f. rosea is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
